question: Which of the following expression can be deduced on the basis of dimensional analysis? (All symbols have their usual meanings)
explanation: Dimensional analysis cannot determine dimensionless constants like <katex>$\cos, e, \frac{1}{2}$</katex> etc.
Only the form of dependencies like <katex>$F \propto \eta r v$</katex> can be derived. The constant <katex>$6\pi$</katex> is experimental.

However, among options, relations involving transcendental functions (cos, exp) or sums cannot be fully derived strictly from dimensions alone without knowing the structure. Stokes law is often cited as a classic example of dimensional derivation (excluding the constant).
